Getting Started with O2DES Studio

Learn how to create your first simulation model using O2DES Studio.

Installation

Prerequisites

  • Node.js 18.0 or higher
  • npm or yarn package manager
  • Git (optional)
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/your-username/o2des-studio.git

# Navigate to project directory
cd o2des-studio

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
npm run dev

Creating Your First Model

    1. Create Project
    1. Click "New Project" in the top menu 2. Enter a project name 3. Choose a template (or start blank) 4. Click "Create"
    2. Add Nodes
    1. Drag nodes from the sidebar 2. Position them on the canvas 3. Configure node properties
    3. Connect Nodes
    1. Click and drag from a node's output handle 2. Connect to another node's input handle 3. Configure connection properties

    Basic Workflow

    Step-by-Step Guide

    1. Node Types

    • Source: Generates entities
    • Process: Handles entity processing
    • Queue: Manages entity queuing
    • Sink: Removes entities from simulation

    2. Connections

    • Connect nodes using handles
    • Configure flow properties
    • Set routing conditions

    3. Properties

    • Double-click nodes to edit properties
    • Use the properties panel
    • Configure simulation parameters

    Example Model

    Here's a simple queuing system:

    graph LR
    A[Source] --> B[Queue]
    B --> C[Process]
    C --> D[Sink]

    Keyboard Shortcuts

    Action Shortcut
    Delete Node Delete/Backspace
    Copy Ctrl/Cmd + C
    Paste Ctrl/Cmd + V
    Undo Ctrl/Cmd + Z
    Redo Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + Z

    Next Steps

    • Learn about Basic Features
    • Explore Advanced Features
    • Check out example models in the Templates section

    Pro Tips

    • Use the grid snap feature for clean layouts
    • Save your work frequently
    • Start with simple models and gradually add complexity
    • Use the built-in validation tools
